call_title: Moria Finance | Lgd and MGpai | ErgoHack VIII

topics.title: Moria Finance Project Introduction and Team
topics.summary: Luca introduces Moria Finance, an ErgoHack VIII project created by a team of five developers. The project aims to create a financial platform for managing funds with smart contract wallets and multisig functionality, though they focused on multisig implementation due to time constraints.

topics.title: Multisig Protocol Implementation Using EIP-42
topics.summary: The team implemented multisig following the EIP-42 protocol with modifications, using creator-provided addresses instead of zero-derivation indices. They reverse-engineered the open-source Minotaur Wallet to understand the multisig implementation process.

topics.title: Database Architecture and Communication System
topics.summary: The project uses PostgreSQL with Supabase for data coordination between multisig signers, featuring four main entities with relational connections. Future plans include Supabase Realtime for live chat messaging and notifications, creating Discord-like channels for each multisig wallet.

topics.title: Nautilus Wallet Fork for Multisig Support
topics.summary: The team created a Nautilus fork adding two new methods for multisig transactions: generate commitments and sign transaction multi. Captain Nemo will integrate these features into the official Nautilus wallet with the v3 manifest release.

topics.title: Backend Infrastructure and ErgoPay Integration
topics.summary: The backend provides secure authentication and services for ErgoPay and Ergo Mobile Wallet integration. While ErgoPay isn't currently supported due to missing signing methods, the infrastructure is prepared for future mobile wallet fork implementation.

topics.title: Frontend Design and Lord of Rings Theme
topics.summary: The frontend uses Next.js with a Moria-themed design inspired by Lord of the Rings, featuring black, grey, and gold color schemes. The team implemented component reusability and good frontend practices, keeping the code closed source for now.

topics.title: Live Demo: Wallet Creation and Setup
topics.summary: mgPai demonstrates creating a new multisig wallet with 2-of-2 threshold, adding signers, and setting up the wallet structure. The demo shows the user onboarding process and initial wallet configuration, including plans for anti-spam fees.

topics.title: Live Demo: Transaction Creation and Signing Process
topics.summary: The demo shows the complete multisig transaction flow: funding the wallet, creating a transaction to Sigmanauts, commitment phase by both signers, signing phase, and final blockchain submission. The process demonstrates multisig-to-multisig transfers and the two-phase signing protocol.
